name: 69TheGrove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb, within easy Thames river side walk to Westminster and very near Vauxhall tube. The breakfast was very good with fruit, yoghurt, cereals and full english. Hosts very friendly & welcoming. We had one of the new lower ground en-suite rooms. Adequate size but noisy from main downpipe of the house outside of window i.e. you hear water flushing down pipe whenever anyone uses taps, shower or toilets. Also awake with first guests having breakfast at 7.30am on floor above you. You are on flight path but this didn't bother us as much as the downpipe.
reviews.title: Great location, v good breakfast, noisy bedroom

reviews.text: We satyed 3 nights and didn't get change of towels until we asked on penultimate night, which we thought was poor. Generally clean but en-suite had a thick layer of dust on ridge of tiles which my wife couldn't leave after 2 days.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Overall very good accomodation but not what we expected from a number 2 rating out of over 300 B&Bs in London.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.text: I and my family had a very lovely stay at 69The Grove. I felt welcomed to be there. The rooms and the building itself was clean and light. At first I was offered a room on the ground floor but since I'm a light sleeper I asked if there was another room available upstairs and was very happy that they did even though it had a separate bathroom downstairs. The breakfast was amazing with freshly made fruit salad and delicious full English breakfast. The location is great as it is only 5 min away from the Vauxhall tube station and away from the main street. Sainsbury's grocery store is only 15 min walk away from the place as well if you wish to buy food. During my stay the weather was unusually cold but the rooms were warm and cozy.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Thank you again Kanley and David.
reviews.title: It didn't seem like to be in busy London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a delightful 5 nights at this b & b. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room has been renovated recently and it's clean and cosy. The breakfast they served is more than ample. The tube station is just a short walk and so very conveniently. All and all it's a keeper for sure.
reviews.title: hidden gem
It was like coming "home" each night of our week in London--cozy, quiet, comfortable, and friendly.
reviews.text: Kanley and David are excellent hosts, and they regard their work as opening their home to travellers from around the world. Breakfast each morning was a delight--a chance to meet fellow travelers and feast on Kanley's generous cooking (and one morning when I was too tired to come to breakfast, David insisted on sending up a tray with a nice pot of tea for me to enjoy in my room). Vauxhall is a great location--a quiet, residential area just across the bridge from the heart of London. The tube station is only five minutes away, but during my stay, a physical injury prevented me from taking cabs or using transit, and so I was especially glad that I could walk to so many interesting destinations from the B&B--ten minutes to the London Eye, twenty minutes to the Tate Britain, thirty minutes to Houses of Parliament/Westminster Abbey/Buckhingham Palace. And each night, we really felt like we were coming home, to our lovely room, with fresh cut flowers from our hosts.

We had booked well in advance, but then the Icelandic volcano caused our flight to be cancelled. Kanley and David were wonderful about changing our reservation to the following week, finding a room for us at the last minute. They are dears, and I would recommend this B&B most heartily.
reviews.title: There is no better place

reviews.text: This was my first experience with a B & B. Kanley is the domestic side of the partnership and David is the businessman. From the moment we arrived, the warmth and hospitality was overflowing. Kanley sat us down for tea/coffee and then gave us a tour of all the available bedrooms (they were all beautiful so it was hard to choose). Breakfast was amazing. From the freshly cut-up fruit salad to the eggs, sausage, ham, beans, grilled tomatoes and juice - don't worry about calories since it's all fresh and/or organic and, you'll probably walk them off sightseeing anyway. It was a pleasure being welcomed into their home as one of the family. I can't wait for my return visit which I hope will be soon!
reviews.title: great place very friendly stuff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a new renovated nice en-suite room. The breakfast was very delicious and the stuff is very friendly and help where they can.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay - friendly hosts and yummy breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staying with Kanley and David was like visiting old friends, even though this was our first stay at the Grove.
reviews.title: great hosts,good value

reviews.text: They made us feel right at home and nothing was too much trouble.for us in particular,it's potion is perfect,the tube it just around the corner,so where ever you want to go in London is no problem.
reviews.title: Brilliant , better than a hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the breakfast was a social event,meeting people from all over the world,and the food itself was of very high quality.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic stay ! Very warm , friendly atmosphere . Smiling ,welcoming hosts . Nothing was too much trouble. Always ready to help . Respected our privacy.
reviews.title: A Bed, Breakfast & Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely pristine accomodation . Very tranquil and relaxing. Large comfortable beds ensured a good nights sleep . Modern en suite. Well stocked mini 'fridge , snacks and beverages. Lovely fresh flowers and plants.Our teenage son loved having his own room , en suite and flat screen T.V. .
reviews.title: This is the only place to stay in London!

reviews.text: David and Kanley were wonderful hosts, making my parents and myself feel right at home and looked after. Kanley did not just give directions to his recommended restaurant on our first night, he walked us all the way there (in the rain, no less!) and told the maitre d' to treat us well. The rooms are beautifully remodeled and maintained, a fine amount of space and lots of light -- even in our rooms downstairs. The ensuite bathroom was truly tiny, but that's to be expected in London. B&B is in a great location -- around the corner from the tube, with easy access to Victoria station. Breakfast was perfect and it was a delight to sit in the kitchen eating with David and Kanley when the dining table was full. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.text: Just stayed one night but felt very welcome. Very helpful in accommodating my needs. Bathroom was on floor below room but clean and good shower. Room comfortable and warm. Breakfast excellent - freshly prepared fruit salad and cooked breakfast. Close to tube as mentioned previously and quiet area (for London).
reviews.title: Great breakfast!

reviews.text: Kanley and David are the tippity- top when it comes to hosts, they really make you feel like you are welcome and they are happy you came. I'm a good spotter of insincerity and found none here.
reviews.title: Warm, welcoming, clean, awesome, everything!!!

reviews.text: The rooms (at least the one me & my son were in) are spotless, everything is the latest without being antiseptic. Heating is ample. We were on the bottom floor and it was very quiet (except when the guy in the next room turned on the water...but that was infrequent).
reviews.title: Fabulous place and fabulous hosts

reviews.text: And the breakfast! OMG!! Eggs, bacon, sausage, baked beans, tomatoes, mushrooms, fruit salad, yogurt. I think if I had asked for an artichoke cooked in Yorkshire pudding batter Kanley would have made it for me, and happily.
reviews.title: Warm hearted hosts and hip rooms.

description: 69TheGrove is a welcoming and quiet Bed and Breakfast in a lovely Victorian house located in a quiet street in the heart of Vauxhall, Central London.This accommodation is perfect for those who are visiting London for a short break, holiday or business due to our location.
